items.content_html:
Summary

Removed redundant "Polyfill" section.

Motivation

The documents already have a link to the polyfill in the "See also" section. Also, almost all documents that have a link to the polyfill contain it in the "See also" section, not in a separate section.

items.title: Remove redundant "Polyfill" section

items.content_html:
Summary

Moved polyfill links to the "See also" section in the documents where the "Polyfill" section contains only a link to the polyfill. So the "Polyfill" section is eliminated in these documents.

Motivation

Consistency improvement. I found that there are about 300 documents with a link to the polyfill in the "See also" section. And there are only 16 documents that have a link to the polyfill in a separate section.

Metadata

  • Adds a new document
  • Rewrites (or significantly expands) a document
  • Fixes a typo, bug, or other error
items.title: Move polyfill link to "See also" section

items.content_html:
Summary

Description of NodeFilter.FILTER_REJECT on this page is not correct. If NodeFilter.FILTER_REJECT is returned in NodeIterator then subtree nodes are processed. Subtree nodes are not processed only in TreeWalker when NodeFilter.FILTER_REJECT is returned.

I copied correct description from this page.

Motivation

Supporting details

Related issues

items.title: Correct the description of NodeFilter constants

items.content_html:
Bumps actions/checkout from 2 to 3.

Release notes

Sourced from actions/checkout's releases.

v3.0.0

  • Update default runtime to node16

v2.4.0

  • Convert SSH URLs like org-<ORG_ID>@github.com: to https://github.com/ - pr

v2.3.5

Update dependencies

v2.3.4

  • Add missing awaits
  • Swap to Environment Files

v2.3.3

  • Remove Unneeded commit information from build logs
  • Add Licensed to verify third party dependencies

v2.3.2

Add Third Party License Information to Dist Files

v2.3.1

Fix default branch resolution for .wiki and when using SSH

v2.3.0

Fallback to the default branch

v2.2.0

Fetch all history for all tags and branches when fetch-depth=0

v2.1.1

Changes to support GHES (here and here)

v2.1.0

  • Group output
  • Changes to support GHES alpha release
  • Persist core.sshCommand for submodules
  • Add support ssh
  • Convert submodule SSH URL to HTTPS, when not using SSH
  • Add submodule support
  • Follow proxy settings
  • Fix ref for pr closed event when a pr is merged
  • Fix issue checking detached when git less than 2.22
Changelog

v2.0.0

items.content_html:
Bumps actions/labeler from 3 to 4.

Release notes

Sourced from actions/labeler's releases.

v4.0.0

  • Update to node 16 runtime

v3.1.0

Dependency upgrades, docs updates, and behind-the-scenes maintenance.

See the full list of changes since 3.0.2 here: actions/labeler@v3.0.2...v3.1.0

Thanks to @​GisoBartels and @​Muhammed-Rahif for their contributions!

v3.0.2

No API changes, but lots of behind-the-scenes upgrades, mostly to internal dependencies, tooling, and surrounding infrastructure.

v3.0.1

No user-facing changes.

That said, there were more than enough behind-the-scenes changes to warrant a new release: actions/labeler@v3.0.0...v3.0.1

items.title: Bump actions/labeler from 3 to 4

items.content_html:
Summary

I have mentioned outline-offset, border-radius affecting outline angles and gave more details about non-rectangular shape of an outline.

Motivation

Statement that outline property sets "all" outline related features was misleading.
Default value of outline-color has been corrected.
I believe mentioning outline-offset and border-radius on that page will give users wider understanding about what we can do with outline.
Last change is related to non-rectangular shape of an outline. Previous note was very vague.

It's my first pull request, everything looks to be alright?

Supporting details

I have mentioned that default value of outline-color can be "invert", which can be checked in https://drafts.csswg.org/css-ui/#outline-color and https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/outline-color#formal_definition

In changes I have also stated that border-radius is affecting edges of outline. Linked specification mentiones "To the extent that the outline follows the border edge, it should follow the border-radius curve.".

Last notable difference was about non-rectangular shape of an outline. It is mentioned in linked specification in sentence "The parts of the outline are not required to be rectangular. ". It can be verified by following markup: <div style="width: 200px"><span style="outline: 1px solid blue">Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit.</span></div>
On Google Chrome single line wraps whole text, while on firefox, separate lines surround each line box.

Related issues

Metadata

  • Adds a new document
  • Rewrites (or significantly expands) a document
  • Fixes a typo, bug, or other error
items.title: Few changes to outline.

items.content_html:
In topic, "Accessing every item" , we are printing the string whose length is greater than 8 characters long. But, In theory they mentioned that " The code below takes an array of strings and filters out all strings that are less than 8 characters long:". Instead of "less" word "greater" word is correct.

Link : https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/JavaScript/First_steps/Arrays

This is the fifth PR that updates the final module, Client-side web APIs. It makes minor updates to the fifth article, Video and audio.

This PR has a corresponding PR in mdn/learning-area: both PRs should be merged together, and changes in one will need corresponding changes in the other one. For that reason I'm marking it draft, although it is ready for review.

items.title: Django 4: Update development/deployment pt1

items.content_html:
Fixes #13286. This is blocked on mdn/yari#5329. Set.prototype.keys() is intentionally not in BCD; instead, keys is listed as an alternative_name for Set.prototype.values(). And at https://tc39.es/ecma262/multipage/keyed-collections.html#sec-set.prototype.keys, keys() has its own section in the spec that we want to link to; we don’t want to link to the values() section of the spec (because that part of the spec says nothing at all about keys() being an alias for values()). So, to override the spec URL we get back from BCD, we need to use:

{{Specifications("https://tc39.es/ecma262/multipage/keyed-collections.html#sec-set.prototype.keys")}}
items.title: Add a Set.prototype.keys() article

items.content_html:
Part of #10337, the project to modernize the JS Learning Area.

This is the fifth PR that updates the final module, Client-side web APIs. It makes minor updates to the fifth article, Drawing graphics.

Many of the changes here are to reflect some juggling of example code in mdn/learning-area, especially to have JS in separate files. So this PR has a corresponding PR in mdn/learning-area: both PRs should be merged together, and changes in one will need corresponding changes in the other one. For that reason I'm marking it draft, although it is ready for review.
items.title: JS Learn: update client-side APIs, part 5

items.content_html: Part of #13126. Many of these documents already had a browser-compat key — and thus didn’t need a spec-urls key. So in those cases, this change just replaces the manual specifications table with a {{Specifications}} macro.
